statement:
Let $\Gamma$ be a compact Lie group and let $g_1,\ldots ,g_r$ generate
the module $\vec{\mathcal{P}}(\Gamma )$*(the space of
$\Gamma$-equivariant polynomial mappings)* of $\Gamma$-equivariant
polynomials over the ring $\mathcal{P}(\Gamma)$*(the ring of
$\Gamma$-invariant polynomial)*. Then $g_1,\ldots ,g_r$ generate the
module $\vec{\mathcal{E}}(\Gamma)$*(the space of $\Gamma$-equivariant
germs at the origin of $C^\infty$ mappings)* over the ring
$\mathcal{E}(\Gamma)$*(the ring of $\Gamma$-invariant germs)*. [@1]

[2]{} Golubitsky, Martin. Stewart, Ian. Schaeffer, G. David:
Singularities and Groups in Bifurcation Theory *(Volume II)*.
Springer-Verlag, New York, 1988. Poénaru, V.:Singularités $C^\infty$ en
Présence de Symétrie. Lecture Notes in Mathematics 510, Springer-Verlag,
Berlin, 1976.
